titleStmt.title: Green V. Hall to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG14092

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p:
Stanton Oct 17. 1865
Thos E. Bramlette Gov. of Ky.
Dear Sir

We take the privelege of addressing afew lines, to you in regard to the recruiting a Company of Enrolled Militia for our County. It does Seem fit and proper to give this Country an oppurtunity of raising a Company for ^its^ defense of this There is no section in Ky where troops are needed more, than in this country-, Powell Co Situated as it is in the very midst of the Mountains, infested with rogues and geurrillas ever since the war Commenced -- Sent her sons to the field with out Stint, never suffered herself to be drafted -- should have some of the priveleges bestowed upon more fortunate counties -- I flatter myself having more than three years experience in the Federal Service as Capt. ^of the 24th Vofl- Inf-^ that I can render yet some service to my native state -- I have learned that an order has been issued to raise Companies in other Counties: If such be the fact I hope I will be advised of the fact and authority given me to recruit a Company &c

Stanton, Powell county.
Oct. 17, 1865
Hall, Capt. Green V.
(To Govener.)
Desires to recruit a Co. of active militia in Powell county, as it is badly needed -- the county being situated in the mountains, and infested with rogues and guerillas.

Ans Oct 26. Let Bk B, p. 306
Rec. I. G. O. Oct 24, '65.
